intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I see you made it here safely, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, Father. Long have I wished to see you and visit Castle Krakenburg again. I feel like I’m dreaming…

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: It is only thanks to your diligence that you are here. I am told you are now a warrior almost on par with Xander. You finally possess the strength to be an instrument of Nohr’s power in the world.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: But, Father, will he/she be all right outside of the fortress?

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: I worry about that as well. Isn’t it dangerous for Corrin to live outside the fortress’s magical barrier?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I appreciate your concern, but I earned my way here and I’m ready to fight.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Corrin, as you know, Nohr is at war with the eastern kingdom of Hoshido.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes, Father. I have heard as much.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: We of the royal family are descendants of the ancient gods, the First Dragons. As inheritors of that divine strength, we conquer those who oppose us with ease. One who learns to wield that power can destroy an entire army of common troops. Xander, Camilla, and Leo have already shown that they possess this power. I expect no less from you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I am aware of your expectations, Father. And I have trained every day to become more like my siblings.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Hmm…you show promise. But you will need a suitable weapon in order to serve Nohr.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow…

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: This is Ganglari, a sword infused with magic from another world. With this sword at your side, you will crush the Hoshidan army with ease.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you for this generous gift, Father.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Hmm… Generous indeed.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Now, let us see you put that sword to its proper use… Bring out the prisoners!

intro.speaker: Nohrian
intro.line: Yes, sire!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Prisoners?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: These are prisoners from our most recent skirmish with Hoshido. I want to see your power with my own eyes. Use that sword to strike them down.

intro.speaker: Gunter
intro.line: I shall join you, milord/milady. My lance arm is perhaps rusty but still serviceable. Felicia/Jakob, will you join us well?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Of course! I’m as much a bodyguard as a domestic, after all. To be honest, I was never that great at the domestic stuff anyway.

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Naturally. I couldn't allow someone of your advanced years to bear the burden alone. Lady Corrin, there is no need for you to soil your hands with this filth. Please relax and leave the fighting to us. Afterward, I will prepare you some tea.

intro.speaker: Rinkah
intro.line: I am Rinkah! Daughter of the Flame Tribe’s honorable chieftain. What is your name, Nohrian prince/princess?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I’m Corrin.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Corrin… Can it be?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Huh? Have you heard of me?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: … I am Kaze, a ninja of Hoshido. Show me what you can do.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Kill them all.

battle.speaker: Gunter
battle.line: Remain focused, milord/milady. This is no mock battle-a mistake here could cost you your life.

battle.speaker: Felicia
battle.line: You should know I’m trained to use daggers-up close or thrown from afar. I can even hit enemies hiding behind walls, which might come in handy!

battle.speaker: Jakob
battle.line: Milady, I'm well trained in the dagger─effective both up close and at range. I can even attack foes hiding behind walls, which may prove useful.

battle.speaker: Gunter
battle.line: Remember your training. Each weapon has strengths and weaknesses. You would do well to consider them before you attack.

battle.speaker: Jakob
battle.line: I’m sure you know this, milord/milady, but it’s useful to stay close to your allies. If you fight side by side, you can help each other in battle/combat.

battle.speaker: Felicia
battle.line: Maids can also use staves to heal wounds. If you get hurt, let me know right away!

battle.speaker: Jakob
battle.line: Butlers can also use staves to heal wounds. Please inform me immediately should you become injured.

recruit-battle.speaker: Kaze
recruit-battle.line: A ninja’s Shuriken may not cut deep, but it can sap you of your strength. Your death need not come all at once!

recruit-battle.speaker: Rinkah
recruit-battle.line: Behold the might of the Flame Tribe!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: So this is how it ends…

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Phew! They’re really tough, aren’t they? I hope all Hoshidans aren’t this strong.

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Don’t just stand there, idiot boy/girl. Finish them!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But. Father…they’re beaten. You want me to execute helpless prisoners?

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: You dare question me?! I order you to kill them!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No! It’s wrong!

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: I won’t argue the point any further.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gods!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Hm?

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Corrin! What are you-

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Unbelievable…

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: You would defy me directly, Corrin?!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Father, please forgive him/her! He/She doesn’t yet understand our situation…

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Fine. Xander, you kill them. And if anyone gets in your way, kill them too.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Ngh.

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: DO IT! KILL THEM ALL!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Stand down, Corrin. If you don’t, I will be forced to-

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No, Xander. I won’t let you do this!

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Why do you refuse, Corrin? You know the Hoshidans are our sworn enemies.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I know, but…this is different. These people can’t fight anymore. Why not show mercy?

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: Please, Corrin, don’t fight him… My dear, sweet Corrin…

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: No no no! Leo, what should we do?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: *sigh* Why does this fall to me?

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Father, I have dispatched our enemies on behalf of my softhearted brother/sister.

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Hmph.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: I only ask that you would be merciful in your punishment of him/her…

end.speaker: Garon
end.line: Enough! I will consider the matter later.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo! How could you?! They were beaten! There was no reason to execute them!

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Agreed. Now hush.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo, did you-

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Enough, both of you. The battle is over.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Mark my words, Corrin… One day, an act of kindness may be the death of you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Perhaps, but if I’m kind. I will die without regrets.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: …Well said. Guard! I would examine the prisoners’ belongings. Bring their remains to my quarters.

end.speaker: Nohrian
end.line: Yes, Your Highness!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Leo, your spell…

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: Was only enough to weaken them, yes. I should have followed Father’s orders. But Camilla and Elise always make such a fuss when I do anything to upset you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Leo. I’m sorry for teasing you about your collar.

end.speaker: Leo
end.line: *sigh* You can repay me by not mentioning it again.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: That was great, Brother!

end.speaker: Camilla
end.line: It was, but I doubt this will be the last we hear of this. Father never forgets a slight.

end.speaker: Xander
end.line: Listen well. It is only my brother’s/sister's kind heart that has bought your freedom. Disappear now, lest you be spotted by our king.

end.speaker: Rinkah
end.line: Tch. I am not a hostage to be freed. You said your name is Corrin? When next we meet, I will make you pay for this humiliation!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I was hoping the next time we met, it could be as friends.

end.speaker: Rinkah
end.line: Softhearted fool! I am a Hoshidan warrior. You do not understand what you suggest.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I understand that right now Hoshido and Nohr are at war. But I’m trying to plan ahead for the day the war is over and we can live in peace.

end.speaker: Rinkah
end.line: I’ve heard rumors of a sheltered Nohrian prince/princess who knows nothing of the world. I see those rumors are true. If we do meet again, the world will have no doubt taught you the error your ways.
